metadata.Title: CVE-2020-9948 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
A type confusion issue was addressed with improved memory handling. Thisissue is fixed in Safari 14.0. Processing maliciously crafted web contentmay lead to arbitrary code execution.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-9948` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.30.1-1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.30.1-1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.30.1-1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.30.1-1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.30.1-1
webkit2gtk-driver - 2.30.1-1
No subscription required

libwpewebkit-1.0-3 - 2.30.0-1
wpewebkit-driver - 2.30.0-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: webkit2gtk package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.30.1-1').
qtwebkit-opensource-src package in esm-apps/jammy is affected and may need fixing.
wpewebkit package in esm-apps/jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.30.0-1').
